original_solution_mapping.L1: There are 80 cherries in a pound and she needs 3 pounds to make a pie so she needs 80*3 = <<80*3=240>>240 cherries
original_solution_mapping.L2: It takes her 10 minutes to pit a unit of 20 cherries. She has 240/20 = <<240/20=12>>12 units of cherries to pit
original_solution_mapping.L3: It takes 10 minutes to pit a unit of cherries and she has 12 units so it will take her 10*12 = <<10*12=120>>120 minutes
original_solution_mapping.L4: 60 minutes are in 1 hour and it takes her 120 minutes so that's 120/60 = <<120/60=2>>2 hours

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 591.
    Returns: the total time in hours Veronica will take to pit all the cherries.
    """
    # L1
    cherries_per_pound = 80 # There are 80 single cherries in one pound of cherries
    pounds_needed = 3 # 3 pounds of pitted cherries
    total_cherries = cherries_per_pound * pounds_needed

    # L2
    cherries_per_unit = 20 # 20 cherries
    num_units = total_cherries / cherries_per_unit

    # L3
    minutes_per_unit = 10 # 10 minutes to pit 20 cherries
    total_minutes = minutes_per_unit * num_units

    # L4
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    total_hours = total_minutes / minutes_per_hour

    # FA
    answer = total_hours
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There are {cherries_per_pound} cherries in a pound and she needs {pounds_needed} pounds to make a pie so she needs {cherries_per_pound}*{pounds_needed} = <<{cherries_per_pound}*{pounds_needed}={total_cherries}>>{total_cherries} cherries

It takes her 10 minutes to pit a unit of {cherries_per_unit} cherries. She has {total_cherries}/{cherries_per_unit} = <<{total_cherries}/{cherries_per_unit}={num_units}>>{num_units} units of cherries to pit

It takes {minutes_per_unit} minutes to pit a unit of cherries and she has {num_units} units so it will take her {minutes_per_unit}*{num_units} = <<{minutes_per_unit}*{num_units}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes

{minutes_per_hour} minutes are in 1 hour and it takes her {total_minutes} minutes so that's {total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: There are 80 cherries in a pound and she needs 3 pounds to make a pie so she needs 80*3 = <<80*3=240>>240 cherries
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: It takes her 10 minutes to pit a unit of 20 cherries. She has 240/20 = <<240/20=4800>>4800 units of cherries to pit
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: It takes 10 minutes to pit a unit of cherries and she has 4800 units so it will take her 10*4800 = <<10*4800=48000>>48000 minutes
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: 60 minutes are in 1 hour and it takes her 48000 minutes so that's 48000/60 = <<48000/60=800>>800 hours

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '*' instead.
